description:
a hand-drawing inspired by a poem of turkish poet onur b. (honorflagraiser).

reverse-pugio, time's short Poetry must start somewhere:
maybe we should burn the trees we lie in the shades of
before its fruits fall among us,
maybe your nails should erase my lineage
'cause pride is a yoke to me.

i can watch New York burn, it's my pleasure:
whit blood map of Istanbul on my back,
i can sacrifice all humane values to the naked grace of Rome.

do not condemn me, everyone will die one day!
and as the city rushes to our souls with its burning galleons
i think life becomes seeing the glory of a world's being wrecked in the eyes of a stabbed sultan.
